sen.j: 屯鶴峯（どんづるぼう）は、奈良県香芝市にある奇岩群・奇勝。
sen.e: Donzurubo are oddly-shaped rock outcroppings and is an odd sight in Kashiba City, Nara Prefecture.
Donzurubo is a place of odd sight in Kashiba City, Nara Prefecture, where oddly-shaped rock outcrops can be seen.
Donzurubo is a place of odd sight in Kashiba City, Nara Prefecture, where oddly-shaped rock outcrops can be seen.

sen.j: 二上山 (奈良県・大阪府)の火山活動により火山岩屑が沈積し、その後の隆起によって凝灰岩が露出し、1500万年間の風化・浸食を経て奇岩群となった標高約150mの岩山。
sen.e: Tuff appeared due to uplifting after volcanic detritus accumulated due to the volcanic activity of Mt. Nijo (Nara Prefecture, Osaka Prefecture), and the tuff turned into oddly-shaped rock outcroppings, a crag at 150 meters in height, after it was weathered and eroded for 15 million years.

Volcanic detritus had been accumulated by volcanic activities of Mt. Nijo (Nara Prefecture, Osaka Prefecture) and later tuff appeared on the ground due to earth uplifting; since then the tuff has undergone weathering and erosion for 15 million years to become a crag at 150 meters in height having oddly-shaped rock outcrops.

Volcanic detritus had been accumulated by volcanic activities of Mt. Nijo (Nara Prefecture, Osaka Prefecture) and later tuff appeared on the ground due to earth uplifting; since then the tuff has undergone weathering and erosion for 15 million years to become a crag at 150 meters in height having oddly-shaped rock outcrops.

sen.j: 県天然記念物であり、金剛生駒紀泉国定公園の見所の一つである。
sen.e: It is a natural monument designated by Nara prefecture, and is one of sightseeing spots of Kongo Ikoma Kisen Quasi-National Park.
It is a natural monument designated by Nara prefecture, and is one of sightseeing spots of Kongo Ikoma Kisen Quasi-National Park.
It is a natural monument designated by Nara prefecture, and is one of sightseeing spots of Kongo Ikoma Kisen Quasi-National Park.

sen.j: 第二次世界大戦中に造られた複雑な防空壕があることでも知られる。
sen.e: It is well known for the complicated air-raid shelter developed during the World War II.
It is famous for a complex air-raid shelter constructed during the World War II.
It is famous for a complex air-raid shelter constructed during the World War II.

sen.j: 本土決戦を目前にした陸軍が航空部隊・航空総軍の戦闘司令所として建設されたもので、二つの壕に分かれている。
sen.e: It was built as the battle headquarters of Air units and Air Army before the decisive war in the mainland, and it consisted of two shelters.
It was built as the top headquarters of air battle units of the Imperial Japanese Army in preparation for the coming decisive battles in the mainland, and it consisted of two shelters.
It was built as the top headquarters of air battle units of the Imperial Japanese Army in preparation for the coming decisive battles in the mainland, and it consisted of two shelters.

sen.j: 現在、防空壕の一部は京都大学防災研究所附属地震予知研究センター屯鶴峯観測所として使用されている。
sen.e: Currently, a part of air-raid shelter is used as Donzurubo Observatory of Research Center for Earthquake Prediction DPRI, Kyoto University.
sen.cmt: 一原文・一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: Currently, a part of air-raid shelter is used as Donzurubo Observatory of Research Center for Earthquake Prediction DPRI, Kyoto University.
Currently, a part of air-raid shelter is used as Donzurubo Observatory of Research Center for Earthquake Prediction DPRI, Kyoto University.

sen.j: 地震予知研究計画の一環として地殻変動の連続観測が実施されている。
sen.e: The continual observation of diastrophism as a part of earthquake prediction research project is made.
sen.cmt: 一原文・一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: Observation of diastrophism as a part of earthquake prediction research project has been continuously carried out.
Observation of diastrophism as a part of earthquake prediction research project has been continuously carried out.

sen.j: 灰白色の断崖が続きそれが鶴の群れに見えることから名付けられた。
sen.e: It was named as a row of grayish white cliffs looked like a flock of cranes.
It was named as a row of grayish white cliffs looked like a flock of cranes.
It was named as a row of grayish white cliffs looked like a flock of cranes.

sen.j: マオリ語「トネ・ツル・ポウ（柱を縦に並べて立てたような瘤）」が訛った。
sen.e: It came from the word of Māori language, `tone tsuru pou' (a bump of standing columns which are vertically placed), which was pronounced like Japanese.
It came from the word of Māori language, `tone tsuru pou' (a bump of standing columns which are vertically placed), which was pronounced like Japanese.
It came from the word of Māori language, `tone tsuru pou' (a bump of standing columns which are vertically placed), which was pronounced like Japanese.

sen.j: 遠くからながめると、松林に多くの鶴が屯（たむろ）しているように見えることから「屯鶴峯」（どんづるぼう）と名付けられた
sen.e: It is named as `donzurubo' as it looked like many cranes staying in pine forest when it is viewed from far.
It was named `donzurubo' as it looked as if many cranes were staying in a pine forest when viewed in the distance.
It was named `donzurubo' as it looked as if many cranes were staying in a pine forest when viewed in the distance.

sen.j: 〒639-0252 奈良県香芝市穴虫（二上山の西北、穴虫峠の近く）
sen.e: Anamushi, Kashiba City, Nara Prefecture (the northwest of Mt.Nijo, near Anamushi Pass), zip code 639-0252
Anamushi, Kashiba City, Nara Prefecture (the northwest of Mt.Nijo, near Anamushi Pass), zip code 639-0252

sen.j: 近鉄大阪線 関屋駅 (奈良県) 徒歩約30分
sen.e: Approximately 30 minutes walk from Sekiya Station of Kintetsu Osaka Line (Nara Prefecture)
Approximately 30 minutes walk from Sekiya Station of the Kintetsu Osaka Line (Nara Prefecture)
sen.cmt: Kintetsu Osaka Line --> the Kintetsu Osaka Line
sen.e: Approximately 30 minutes walk from Sekiya Station of the Kintetsu Osaka Line (Nara Prefecture)

sen.j: 近鉄南大阪線 二上山駅 徒歩約30分
sen.e: Approximately 30 minutes walk from Nijozan Station of Kintetsu Minamiosaka Line
Approximately 30 minutes walk from Nijozan Station of the Kintetsu Minamiosaka Line

sen.e: Approximately 30 minutes walk from Nijozan Station of the Kintetsu Minamiosaka Line

sen.j: 国道165号穴虫交差点から、奈良県道・大阪府道703号香芝太子線を太子方面へすぐ。
sen.e: Just after taking Kashiba-Taishi Route of Nara Prefectural road, Osaka Prefectural Road, 703 for Taishi at the Anamushi crossing of National route 165.
At the Anamushi intersection of National route 165, take Kashiba-Taishi Route of Nara Prefectural road, Osaka Prefectural Road, 703, heading for Taishi and you will be get there very soon.
